abstract.p: Photos of recent social gatherings; (Evening Hours column) (M)

block.p: Oct. 24: The International Center of Photography and its trustees invited 150 guests to a preview and dinner for its newly constructed Jill Rose Galleries, at 43rd Street and Avenue of the Americas. They were named for the late Ms. Rose, who was the president of the board of trustees from 1989 to 1996. The evening was also the opening of the main exhibition, ''Reflections in a Glass Eye,'' of works from the center's permanent collection.

Oct. 24: The International Center of Photography and its trustees invited 150 guests to a preview and dinner for its newly constructed Jill Rose Galleries, at 43rd Street and Avenue of the Americas. They were named for the late Ms. Rose, who was the president of the board of trustees from 1989 to 1996. The evening was also the opening of the main exhibition, ''Reflections in a Glass Eye,'' of works from the center's permanent collection.
